intro: Boopis alpina, commonly known as alpine boopis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Boopis alpina is often found in meadows and slopes at high elevations, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in alpine ecosystems.
